Preferred Experience:
 IT experience is one or more of the following: infrastructure service design, engineering or delivery; application development, maintenance and support; business intelligence and analytics; IT communications, Data Scientist

 Strong critical thinking / analysis 

Skills to be successful in this role:
 Strong writing, visualization (e.g., Power Point), data manipulation (e.g., Excel) and web reporting (e.g., html) skills with uncompromising penchant for accuracy and precision 
 Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively within a team and cross-functionally with groups outside the immediate team

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Scientist

details:
Research Analyst
 
I am working with a global technology and research organization that is growing in the Dallas market. This is a fast-paced company that offers growth opportunity in an evolving field.
 
Job Summary: 
Intellectual property is an extremely valuable asset and must be vigorously protected. When creating a new brand, logo or advertising, companies have professionals help them do research to see if this future IP is viable for use and possibly to protect and register in the U.S. or maybe around the world. In this job, you would work with law firms and Fortune 500 companies and learn how to conduct research to identify any potentially confusing and conflicting marks that are owned by others. You would learn how to become an expert in research focused on intellectual property clearance. This is an extremely valued skill set and a skill set that could be the basis for a great, long-term career.
 
Position:
·         A day in the life of a Trademark Research analyst consists of analyzing brand and company data to compile trademark clearance reports for Corsearch clients. Daily tasks involve searching public and proprietary databases to identify similar trademarks and organizing the trademarks according to relevancy.
·         Previous knowledge of trademarks or intellectual property is not required. We will provide training, including trademark law theory and use of proprietary online systems.
·         Candidates should be computer savvy with strong internet research, analytical and language skills and should have proven ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
·         Some customer interaction may be required.
·         Monday – Friday, regular business hours + overtime
·         Base Salary
·         PTO
·         Benefits
 


Requirements:
 

Associates degree required, BA preferred.
Second language preferred but not required.
Must have unrestricted authorization to work in US
Analytical
Good understanding of technology

WHAT CANDIDATES SAY ABOUT THIS RECRUITER:
I was very impressed with Nate’s attention to detail and making sure I had as much information and guidance as possble prior to my phone interview. His comments helped understand the employer’s perspective better.Bruce, Chief Operating Officer in Kentucky
title: Data Scientist

details:
Serve as modelling and data science partner for assigned business areas responsible for the scientific integrity of work products, including study design, research methodology, and deployment of statistical approaches and modelling.Seeking a senior data scientist/predictive modeler to develop statistical models to predict probability of default (PD), expected loss, pricing and credit limit optimization/automation, customer segmentation, propensity to renew, and other opportunities for the trade credit and surety insurance business. Candidate must be hands-on individual with strong technical skills who enjoys analyzing large data sets to solve complex problems, and able to work on a global virtual team. Must have a successful track record of credit model development and deployment. Preferably has trade credit insurance or financial services experience. Strategy and Planning
Data science expert to lead conversation with business, explore data from a modelling perspective, perform initial EDA to assess business value
Work with IM specialist to identify and classify new feature sets, explore machine learning algorithms to extract new feature sets
Provide thought leadership on analytical use case development, validate model builds, lead analytics ideation workshop
Lead analytical discussion with business around “The art of the possible using data science”
Build models and test out hypothesis quickly and in an agile fashion
Build analytical application designs and prototype to test out idea and drive innovation & prototyping
Work with analytics partners to build and implement models and guide model development work
Provide overall coordination and management of several research analysts in designing a comprehensive project or initiative around solving specific problems
Work with the decision analysts to identify and classify new feature sets, explore machine learning algorithms to extract new feature sets
Technical Performance 
Develop new/advance analyses across descriptive, inquisitive, diagnostic, predictive, Contribute to data mining architectures, modeling standards, reporting, and data analysis methodologies
Work with developers, decision analysts, and measurement and insights analysts to extract data relevant for analysis
Create data definitions/dictionary for new database table/file development and/or change/update existing ones as needed for analysis
Respond to and resolve data mining performance issues
Monitor data mining system performance and recommend continuous/process improvements
Experience
5+ years of experience building predictive models
Substantial data science or advanced analytics experience
Master of PhD is an advantage
Experience in working in Big data technology (Hadoop, NoSQL DB)
Degree in Quantitative field (e.g. Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, IT, Computer Science, Operations Research)
Fundamental knowledge of Business Analytics Applications
Knowledge of advanced/complex statistical techniques
Advanced knowledge of Relational Database and SQL programming
Advanced knowledge of Data Visualization Tools and Techniques
Inquisitive and has a strong passion for empirical research and for answering
Can translate advanced/complex quantitative analysis to business application questions with data
Advance technical skills on statistical programming language/s (ex. SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Advance skills on data visualization (MS Excel, Tableau, PowerBI)
Above average analytical skills (e.g. spot trends and opportunities in data, analyze high-volume and multi-dimensional data from varying sources) using quantitative approaches (e.g. statistics, machine learning methods, etc.)
High proficiency in MS Tools (Excel, Access, etc.)
Ability to engage with senior stakeholders and executives
Ability to develop stakeholder relationships
Able to communicate with people with diverse technical background

details:
IBM i Engineer III - 100 % REMOTE - 6+ Month Contract $50-60/hr W2

Summary 
• Provide IBM i Engineer Tier III support for 24x7x365 Managed Services. Support includes incident management, problem management, and change management for devices and resources monitored by Managed Services. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 
• Supports installations, upgrades, configurations, deployments, migrations, and administration of IBM Power Systems hardware with IBM i operating system also including: 
• Hardware Management Console (HMC) 
• Virtual I/O Server (VIOS) 
• IBM i backup and recovery; BRMS 
• Physical and virtual tape library solutions 
• Direct-attached and external storage. 
• Understanding of IBM Power Technology and Power System Configurations 
• Performs management of IBM i customers in partitioned (LPAR) environments. 
• Coordinates IBM i Operating System (OS) version upgrades, PTF(s), CUME(s), and preventative maintenance to minimize risk and service disruptions. Ensures system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency. 
• Performs and supports system recovery. 
• Provides after-hours and weekend support as needed. 
• Responds and solves customer issues utilizing technology tools, procedures, and training through awareness of services offerings and SLAs. 
• Performs break/fix troubleshooting, server and software updates and feature enhancements to relevant technology infrastructure; implements and troubleshoots complex environments. 
• Responds and solves client issues utilizing technology tools, procedures, and training through awareness of service offerings and Service Level Agreements (SLAs). 
• Understands Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and follows predefined ITIL incident, problem and change management processes in place for each client when working to resolve client requests or outages. 
• Maintains current knowledge of core service offerings and SLAs. Have deep understanding of all service offerings to better support client as well as expanding any service offering to current clients. 
• Supports escalated issues; coordinates communications between operations staff; supports staff to resolve complex issues. 
• Participates in managing client change requests and problem ticket resolution. 
• Works with Sales teams and Service Delivery Managers (SDMs) to propose enhancements to client environments. 
• Collects statistical information to monitor growth and reports to management. 
• Acts as escalation point for Tier I and Tier II technical teams. Directs team members in incident, problem and change request resolution and guidance on projects. 
• Follows change management process. 
• Interacts with other support departments to provide resilient computing environments for clients. 
• Documents environments, processes and procedures to enable support of environments by other team members. 
• Provides periodic environment review and suggests enhancements of services or resiliency of environments. 
• Creates, uses, and maintains technical and process documentation. 
• Remains current on technical and company related literature/correspondence and regularly reviews administrative procedures. 
• Coordinates service outages with Service Delivery Managers as required. 
• Documents post-incident response and root cause analysis. 
• Participates in client sales engagements and performs regular environment Service Delivery Reviews (SDRs). 
• Sets course for repeatable processes and auditing  processes against service descriptions. 
• Provides technical leadership and acts as technical resource and mentor to team members. 
• Demonstrates and actively promotes an understanding and commitment to the mission of through performing behaviors consistent with the organization's values.

Responsibilities of the Reliability Engineer include

Improve fixed and rotating equipment asset quality and extend the life of plant operations and equipment
Supervise and/or perform mechanical equipment inspection through their preventative maintenance and mechanical integrity program
Lead equipment inspections using non-destructive methods 
Use engineering expertise to support operations and maintenance through preventative maintenance methods 

Background

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field (Mechanical Engineering, Metallurgical Engineering, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering or related engineering discipline)
Industry experience in industrial manufacturing plants
Hands on experience with inspection of storage tanks, piping systems, pressure vessels

Experience with Non Destructive Testing (NDE) procedures and other preventative maintenance techniques

details:
NEW PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT STATISTICIAN – IRVINE, CA FULL BENEFITS INCLUDED Position Overview:Candidate will provide Subject Matter Expertise in Advanced Statistical Analysis for Medical Device product development teams and across the organization as required.  The majority of time will be spent developing statistical rationale for sample size.  Candidate will also provide regression analysis, ANOVA test support and design of other tests as requested. This position is slated through the end of 2018 with the potential for ongoing extension. Included in the benefits package is 401K, health insurance, 2 weeks of PTO per year, 1 week of sick time per year, and all paid holidays. Required Experience/Education:
 Three to Five years of hands on experience of Statistical support in a medical device or other manufacturing industry.  
 Must demonstrate specific experience with applying statistical methods, creating sampling plans and sample size calculations, and using data analysis in support of objective decision making; Regression Analysis; ANOVA Testing.
 Understanding of probability, statistical theory, statistical estimation, statistical process control, hypothesis testing, non-parametric statistics, time series analysis, linear and logistic regression (regression and classification modeling)
 A working knowledge of Statistical Analysis Software tools, such as, MiniTab, SPC Software, etc.
 Leadership ability in using problem solving techniques including root cause analysis and cause and effect analysis. Working knowledge in using investigational tools, such as, Cause and Effect Diagrams, Process Optimization, Design of Experiments, Trend Analysis, Capability Analysis, Control Charts, Pareto Charting, etc.
 Lead continuous improvement of the new product development processes and procedures and ability to integrate statistical techniques as a part of product development or design changes.
 Individual must have the ability to collaborate with cross functional teams and support current statistical methodologies used in the group.
 Education required is B.S. in a technical discipline at minimum.  Degrees may include Mathematics, Data Science, Analytics, Applied Statistics, Biostatistics or other related experience and/or training.
 Statistician, Quality or other Engineering discipline will be considered if they can demonstrate extensive experience in the above areas.

details:
ESG Automotive is the go-to source for electrical engineering consulting in the automotive industry. Join ESG Automotive’s team and help create the technology of tomorrow.


Job Title: ADAS Algorithm Developer

Location: Troy, Michigan

What you’ll be doing:

An ADAS Algorithm Developer you will be part of an integrated global team, you will develop robust, real-time, vehicle control algorithms for autonomous driving using active safety radar and vision systems.

Responsibilities include:

Algorithm development including: Lane centering, Automatic Lane Change, Adaptive Cruise Control, Lane Keep Assist, Forward Collision Warning, Emergency Automatic Brake, Blind Spot Alert, Cross Traffic Alert, etc.
Data analysis to assess and correct performance deficiencies
In-Vehicle testing and debugging with dSPACE/ControlDesk and CANoe
Function demonstration to OEMs and customer requirement implementation
Optimization for real-time implementation
Performance assessment and reporting


What you need for this position:

Basic qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, computer science or robotics
2+ years of experience in one more of the following areas: PID controller, machine learning, Detection and Estimation, Kalman Filter, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, digital signal processing.


Preferred qualifications:

A background in one or more of the following areas: RADAR, computer vision, sensor fusion, path planning, road model estimate, target selection, vehicle control features, numerical methods, and statistical methods.
Strong knowledge of algorithm development in Simulink, Stateflow, and MATLAB scripting.
Knowledge of production code generation using MATLAB Coder/Simulink embedded coder.
Solid C coding skills for algorithm’s production C code integration, debugging, compilation and data log re-simulation.
Proficient in-vehicle debugging and testing skills using vehicle CAN communication tools (CANoe, CANalyzer, etc.), dSPACE/ControlDesk.
Results oriented, and previous demonstrated experience in product quality and innovation.
Proactive and rigorous, with strong problem solving capability.
Able to develop cost competitive, state of the art, technology for best in class products

Employee Referral Program

Dynamic place to work with variety of projects

Due to our broad range of customers and our activities in future-oriented industries, we offer challenging tasks and activities. Technology and consulting are entwined in all areas of our business. Shorter chains of communication and an open corporate culture make for a straightforward and pleasant working environment in which our employees are able to grow and develop.

As we operate in the high-tech sector, we place particularly high demands on our employees: In addition to solid specialist knowledge and industry experience, we are looking for professional and quality-oriented individuals who are customer- oriented and are able to quickly integrate in multi-disciplinary teams.

details:
Advanced Technology Services (ATS) grew out of the need for American business to remain competitive in a rapidly changing global economy.  ATS has grown into a leading supplier of outsourced factory maintenance, industrial component repair and IT services for top Fortune 500 companies. ATS has improved the performance for the world's most sophisticated companies, and we owe our success to our employees.  Your time and your knowledge are important - make the most of both.  At ATS, we've continually empowered our employees to develop their skills and advance in their careers.  It's our philosophy, along with our uncompromising commitment to customer satisfaction that has made ATS a success and a great place to work.   ATS is currently seeking a Reliability Engineer.  Summary:Enhances the effectiveness of our industrial maintenance organization through developing and implementing various Asset Management strategies and technologies designed to achieve maximum asset performance.   Principal Duties / Responsibilities: 
Promotes and adheres to the ATS safety culture.  Identifies top potential issues leading to lost production and preventable maintenance spending.  Communicates findings with leadership.   Provides solutions to root cause deficiencies and demonstrates economic benefits to their correction.   Actively drives the implementation of equipment improvement projects.   Identifies and implements current and new processes / technologies to increase equipment performance and uptime  Champions systems and best practice procedures towards a proactive manufacturing culture.   Analyzes equipment performance, failure data, and corrective maintenance history to develop and deploy engineering solutions, improved maintenance strategies, preventative maintenance optimization, and other reliability techniques. Provides technical service to operations and manufacturing personnel on equipment related troubleshooting efforts.  Utilizes predictive, preventative, and precision maintenance technologies and strategies designed to identify or control risks prior to failure and ensure optimum maintenance execution.   Collaborates with the maintenance team to prioritize assets and actions by determining failure probabilities and evaluating the risk of compliance, supply, strategy, and cost. Provides training and coaching in ATS Root Cause and Reliability Analysis and takes ownership for ongoing corrective action tracking, implementation and follow up to ensure that all Root Cause Analysis projects are documented.  Ensures compliance with regulatory requirements and ATS policies and procedures.  Physical Demands and Working Conditions:                                                                                                    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk or hear.  The employee is occasionally required to sit.  The employee must occasionally lift and/or move more than 50 pounds.  The employee is regularly required to use close vision and color vision.  The employee is occasionally exposed to outside weather conditions and risk of electrical shock.  Work is typically performed in a factory environment and is usually very loud. In the factory environment, the employee may be exposed to hazardous materials and/or greasy or slippery factory floors.   

 Knowledge, Skills, Abilities (KSAs), & Competencies:     Essential KSAs:  
Bachelor’s degree in engineering (ABET accredited)  Minimum of five years of reliability experience  Demonstrates ability to perform full array of reliability tool sets  Strong technical understanding of electrical or mechanical components, tools, and designs Ability to complete a failure mode effects analysis, cause and effect diagrams, root cause failure analysis, life-cycle costing, and risk analysis Ability to research and apply new equipment technology / trends  Robust problem solving, mathematical, analytical, and decision making skills  Proficiency with computers, maintenance systems, and applications, including Microsoft Office Excellent verbal communication, facilitation, and presentation skills  Strong reporting and technical writing capability    Ability to build and maintain positive, professional relationships    Desirable KSAs: 
Desire to develop into a leadership role  Experience with data trend analysis, vibration analysis, motor current analysis, oil analysis, lubrication and hydraulic testing, laser alignment, nondestructive testing, infrared thermography, ultrasound technology, acoustic reliability technology, Weibull analysis, and Six Sigma or Lean Manufacturing methodologies Knowledge of various government regulations such as, Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP), National Electrical Testing Association (NETA), Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) CMRP certification Green Belt certification  STS certification  Competencies:  
Drive & Motivation  Interpersonal Skills  Task Management  Strategic Skills  Customer Focus Self-awareness  Management & Leadership ATS offers a competitive salary and benefits program which includes:  
Medical/dental plans Prescription drug program Vision plan 401(k) with company match Tuition reimbursement Flexible spending account  ATS is committed to providing equal employment opportunity in all aspects of employment to all applicants and employees, regardless of age, color, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information or other legally protected status.
title: Data Scientist

details:
Position is on the staff of a not-for-profit government consulting firm located in Tysons, VA. The Junior Data Scientist position will be embedded within our LMI Data Analytics Practice and leverage your curiosity and problem solving skills to explore, discover, and predict patterns contained within data sets for a wide range of government clients. This includes the derivation of clear narratives that help our clients understand their data and how those insights address their specific research questions.

Responsibilities


Demonstrate the ability to frame and scale data problems to effectively analyze, visualize and find data solutions.
Possess the ability to work with and manipulate common data formats, including comma-delimited, text files, and JSON.
Analyst must be able to transform data and analysis into informative data visualizations and/or interactive dashboards using open source and commercially available visualization and dashboard tools.
Demonstrate the ability to derive insights and analytic narratives from data and visualizations for effective storytelling and clear communication in response to specific research questions.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, solutions oriented environment focused on client deliverables, analysis and reporting.
Possess the ability to work in teams and independently.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, engineering, or other related business or quantitative discipline is required.
Experience working with tools including object-oriented programming (Python, Java), computational analysis tools (R, MATLAB), and associated data science libraries (scikit-learn).
Experience creating meaningful data visualizations and/or interactive dashboards that communicate your findings and relate them back to how your insights create business impact using platforms such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, RShiny, plotly, and d3.js.
Working knowledge of databases and SQL is desired. Preferred qualifications include linking analytic and data visualization products to database connections.
Preferred experience with data science methods related to data architecture, data munging, data and feature engineering, and predictive analytics. Additional preferred qualifications include working with unstructured text and natural language processing.
Superior communication skills, both oral and written.
Applicants for this position may be subjected to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Please note that only US Citizens are eligible to obtain security clearances.
industry: Government - Civil Service, Consulting, Not for Profit - Charitable

details:
The Quantitative Associate position works within the FP&A Quantitative Analytics team and will develop Dodd-Frank Act Stress Testing (DFAST) stress testing models for a bank wide portfolio.  RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Obtain and conduct data analysis required for stress testing model development. 
Developing and executing primary and benchmark DFAST stress test models for credit risk and PPNR. 
Perform all required tests and measures of developed models (e.g., sensitivity, accuracy, volatility). 
Perform routine analysis for model performance monitoring and model review, maintaining current model inventory for validation and audit compliance. 
Deliver comprehensive model documentation (e.g., Model Development Documents, Model Approval Packages, Technical Review Documents). 
Utilize quantitative skills to analyze and summarize data, formulate findings, and provide recommendations. 
Assist others with conducting business research by gathering data, identifying options, and creating non-routine reports with detailed analyses. 
Perform additional duties as required.
 POSITION REQUIREMENTS: 
Advanced degree in a quant discipline like Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or related field. 
Work or project experience using quantitative analysis to solve problems 
Proficiency in analytical software such as R, Slidify, ShinyApp and Tableau. 
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint or equivalent substitution. 
Proficiency in SQL, being able to handle and perform large scale data manipulation using SQL or R 
Proficiency in multilinear regression modeling, logistic regression modeling, time series modeling, decision tree as well as other programing and data analysis using R 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to explain complex and technical matters clearly, accurately and concisely. 
Strong organizational skills.

details: Location: Baton Rouge, LASalary: $80,000 to $125,000yr. base salary, Depending on Experience Minimum Requirements:B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or Chemical Engineering with 5+ years of out of any PSM regulated Chemical or Petrochemical plant, ideally with large scale rotating equipment, fixed equipment, cryogenics, compressors, distillation units, turbines, data analysis, utilities and distributed controls. details:
Novecare develops leading edge technologies that affect the behavior of fluids to give them cleansing, softening, moisturizing, hydrating, gelling, texturizing, penetrating or dispersing properties. Its products are found in shampoos, detergents, paints, lubricants, plant protection, mining and oil extraction. The reliability engineer leads the effort to continually increase the reliability of process and utility equipment.  His/her efforts always include the highest standards with regard to Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) practices along with cost effective programs and solutions.  HSE RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Fully participate in all plant HSE initiatives including required training to fulfill obligations established by law, corporate policy and site requirements.
Represent Solvay, Inc., through daily actions that reinforce corporate values, demonstrating a personal commitment to a safe, healthy and environmentally sound workplace for employees.  Lead by example.
Maintain the Mechanical Integrity (MI) program and documentation to assure compliance with Solvay and regulatory standards.
Evaluate performance of on-site maintenance contractors, as appropriate
Conduct periodic inspections/audits to assure compliance with existing safety rules and procedures to assess the effectiveness and need for other risk reduction activities
Coordinate investigations of equipment related incident/accidents that may occur in the plant.  Ensure all identified corrective actions are completed.
Develop, maintain and coordinate the administration of a world class PM/PdM maintenance program for the plant including inspection procedures, frequencies, employee training, quality assurance, deficiency mitigation, auditing, and records management, to encompass corporate and legal requirements such as MI and ISO 9002/2000 certification.
Use predictive technologies combined with historical information to identify dominant deterioration and failure modes, causes/effects of deterioration, and corrective actions required (failure analysis and mitigation)
Monitor the work order system to identify opportunities for improvement by eliminating repeat failures.
Develop engineering solutions to maintenance problems, including ways of reducing or eliminating the need for maintenance through equipment replacement or improvement of work practices.
Work with the production and technical departments to develop a critical equipment list, spare parts inventory and reliability strategies for the critical equipment.
Failure analysis and corrective action support for the maintenance technicians
Assist maintenance and operations personnel as needed in day to day equipment trouble-shooting
Work closely with operations department in solving problems required to maximize the OEE of the plant using the resolve maintenance excellence process.
Support the maintenance department in the planning and coordination of PM and MI activities
Identify, scope, and execute small capital projects associated with improving plant reliability.
Support project engineers in the recommendation and specification of equipment for providing the plant with a reliable and robust installation.
Develop and refine plant equipment technical specifications and standards
Support ME initiatives (SOLMAX, SOLWON, 5S, KanBan, TEC, etc.) and champion TPM.
Define and implement equipment filing systems, both electronic (SAP and LAN) and hard copy.
Improve communication between departments at the plant whenever possible.
Continuously upgrade personal technical skill levels to assure application of best available technology and techniques for addressing maintenance/reliability  issues
Serve as the Maintenance Superintendent in his/her absence



Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering.
Experience:  Requires 5 years’ experience in an industrial, production environment with 3+ years in maintenance or reliability.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Good computer skills with working knowledge of MS Word and MS Excel (knowledge of MS PowerPoint, Google Apps and general understanding of databases is a plus).
Knowledge of plant reliability practices, preventive/predictive maintenance practices, mechanical integrity, failure analysis, continuous improvement, and efficiency measurement.
Working knowledge of Computer Based Maintenance Management Systems (SAP knowledge a plus)
Working knowledge of manufacturing practices and process optimization (familiarity with batch and continuous processing a plus).
Familiarity with Industrial Hygiene concepts and Personal Protective Equipment.
Understanding of OSHA standards relating to personnel and the impact of mechanical equipment and instruments on process safety. 
General awareness of air, waste, wastewater, and storm water environmental regulations.

company: Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education
details: Job Classification: Full-Time RegularTwo ORISE opportunities are available with the U.S. Army Medical Research Institute of Chemical Defense. MRICD is seeking college bachelor level student or college graduates in biology, biochemistry, pyschology, neurobiology, neuroscience or similar field. Post-graduates must have completed their degree within the past five years.  U.S. Citizenship is Required.MRICD is seeking ORISE interns to participate in our neuroprotection program. Candidates with experience in animal handling, molecular biology techniques, immunohistochemistry and related-areas are encouraged to apply. Candidates will be involved with animal studies in mice, rats, and guinea pigs to determine the effectiveness of anticonvulsants to terminate nerve agent-induced seizures, evaluating centrally active oximes using similar anticonvulsant models, and continuously measuring brain AChE using in vivo microdialysis techniques. In addition, candidates will be involved in studies utilizing optogenetic manipulations to determine the temporal progression of seizures following nerve agent exposure. The studies will involve surgical preparation of the animals, evaluation of electroencephalographic records and assisting with tissue collection and preparation for histopathological analysis. We employ a multidisciplinary approach to these studies including ELISA, Luminex, immunohistochemistry, and all aspects of histology (i.e., neuroanatomy, staining, imaging analysis, etc.). details:
Machine Vision Research Scientist (DOD Security Clearance)— Torrance, CAA fast-growing Southern California company specializing in military defense, homeland security, and energy solutions is seeking a hand-on Research Scientist for its Electro-Optics Division. The successful candidate should be eager to work in a very dynamic, fast-paced research and development setting with a number of Ph.D.-level engineers and scientists.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 Development, integration, and test of machine vision systems and subsystems.
 Deriving system requirements and specifications with a technical team.
 Developing and realizing software designs as a team member or a technical lead.
 Apply methods of image acquisition/processing/analysis systems and interpreting results of tradeoffs analyses (e.g., resolution, field-of-view, size, weight, power, cost, manufacturability
 Develop new scientific and engineering concepts, carry out design and development, write winning proposals, execute technical tasks of the contract, realize prototypes, perform test and evaluation, provide documentation, manage multidisciplinary projects.
 Participates in and supports development and implementation of new or updated systems, processes, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and/or other relevant tools.

Job Requirements:
 MS required with 5-8 years’ experience, PhD preferred with 3-5 years’ experience (Computer Science, Robotics, Image Processing, and other related engineering areas preferred).
 Experienced in theory and practical implementations of the machine vision, robotic vision, image/video based machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
 Experience in the modern computer science tools (programing languages e.g. Matlab, C/C++, OpenGL and OpenCV libraries, etc.) for 3D reconstruction, object detection, tracking, classification and recognition.
 Demonstrated skills in image processing, computational geometry, computer graphics, mathematical modelling of physical and engineering objects/processes, algorithm development.
 Experienced in methods of image acquisition/processing/analysis systems easy applying results of the tradeoffs analysis (e.g., resolution, field-of-view, size, weight, power, cost, manufacturability) and component selections.
 Ability to multitask and work as individual contributor and be an excellent team player.
 Good verbal and written communication skills are required.
 MUST be eligible for DOD Security Clearance—requires U.S. Citizenship, U.S. Permanent Residency, or other status as defined by 8 USC 1324b(a)(3)

title: Data Scientist

details:
Title: Senior Statistician

Location: Westlake Village, California

Reports to: Senior Director, Analytic Center of Excellence

 The Role:  As a Sr. Statistician in the Analytical Center of Excellence, you will analyze and interpret the results on survey research studies that measure customer satisfaction, provide technical statistical expertise and programming, and build Excel/SAS macros and other automation tools.  Your job is to work closely with other researchers and scientists in the development of sampling plans and analysis plans.  In addition, you will perform advanced multivariate statistical analysis on survey and non-survey data and interpret results for business users.  Preferred but not required skills:  Conjoint, Max Diff and related methodologies; Predictive Analytics/Big Data mining and analysis techniques.

 The Impact: You will support syndicated studies which address industry level consumer needs and serve as customer satisfaction benchmarks in a variety of industries such as Automotive, Financial Services, Insurance, Energy and Telecom. The outcome of your work will be used by clients to help them understand what is important to consumers, how their brand performs relative to their competition, what their brand needs to do to improve and the financial benefit of making these improvements.

 Responsibilities:

• Analysis and Statistical Modeling: Perform multivariate statistical analysis on survey data using SAS.  • Conjoint and Max Diff: Design, program and analyze choice modeling studies using Sawtooth. • Consultation:  Provide statistical consultation to internal JD Power teams as well as external clients.  Provide interpretation of study results. Provide research/analytical support for new business opportunities.  • Thought leadership: Working in collaboration with other team members develop, test, interpret and present research on new and innovative approaches, methods or technicians that can be applied to the advancement of our business.

 The Career Opportunity:  You will have the opportunity to work with industry experts to learn how different industries are structured and how they leverage consumer information to guide product development and service improvements efforts.  You will also have the opportunity to strengthen your research design and statistical skills by daily exposure to senior research staff at JD Power.

The Team / The Business:  The Analytical Center of Excellence has global responsibility for the research design, analyses planning and execution of all advanced analytics at JD Power.  Additionally, the team is responsible for establishing and monitoring the adherence of research best practices that serve as the basis for quality of all research products at JD Power.  Our role is critical to the success of not only individual studies, but to the strength and credibility of the JD Power brand.  You will report directly to the Marketing Sciences Sr. Director and join a team of highly educated and enthusiastic researchers and statisticians that collaborate regularly with each other and with other teams across the firm.

Our Hiring Manager says: I’m looking for someone who can work as part of a broader engagement team and can use our data to help companies understand what drives customer satisfaction for their industry.  This individual also has to work independently to create survey content and analyze data using statistical packages (SAS, SPSS).  In addition, this person will design and program conjoint studies using Sawtooth.  If you’re right for this role, you are a self-starter who is able to develop creative solutions to problems, not be afraid to ask questions as you learn our company’s culture and do it all with enthusiasm.

 

 



• Masters or PhD in Statistics, Econometrics, Psychology or related social science fields.• Travel, some overtime and weekend work is required as needed. • An advanced understanding of Multivariate Statistics, Research Design, Measurement Theory, Attitudinal Research.• Statistical packages—SAS (preferred), SPSS, R, Sawtooth (preferred).• Must be able to work effectively and collaboratively in a team oriented, global, and multi-cultural environment.
location: 30870 Russell Ranch RoadWestlake Village, California, CA 91362

details: Job Description If you are an experienced Reliability Engineer ( Engines) looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!  Reliability Engineer ( Engines)          Job Responsibilities                                                Your specific duties as a Reliability Engineer ( Engines) will include:  Different schedules/business plan that outlines to-do’s for the next 6 months 70-80% of a typical day the candidate will be interfacing with engineers and group manager working on specific projects (DRE) and group managers 20% of a typical day the candidate will be Interfacing with manufacturing engineers, supplier quality, and suppliers 10-20% of a typical day will be spent doing preparation, desk work, meetings, and group meetings The first few months will be a training period to ensure they are familiar with necessary tools. The training will consist of heavy shadowing to meet team members and learn all technical aspects of the engines Interfacing heavily with engineers and organizations. Managing all quality tools Certain activities will be assigned to certain team members. They will have to lead their assigned activities, and heavily interface with other team members Once candidates are assigned duties from the outlined business plans they are responsible for managing those responsibilities from conception to completion Many processes are very standardized. They will receive extensive training on these standardized processes     Reliability Engineer ( Engines) Job Requirements As a Reliability Engineer ( Engines) you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  Manager is seeking an entry level candidate. 0 years of experience is acceptable with the pairing of an engineering bachelor’s degree Bachelor’s Degree in engineering is required (mechanical, chemical, or electrical, etc.)    Must have a strong foundation in a technical field. Must understand the concepts of an engine and the Electrical components of an engine     Reliability Engineer ( Engines) Benefits  As a Reliability Engineer ( Engines) with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for Reliability Engineer ( Engines) Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays  Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening.

Responsibilities - Senior Quantitative Modeler
Develop loss forecasting models including probability of default (PD), exposure at default (EAD), loss given default (LGD) and risk rating migration.
Perform model testing, model implementation and model monitoring.
Prepare comprehensive model documentation that meet internal and regulatory standards.
Participate in all stages of model development from model methodology and framework design, data preparation, segmentation, model development, model testing and calibration.
Implement the models and monitor model performance.
Support independent model validation, internal and external audit, and regulators reviews.
Interacts with model owners/users, validators and regulators to address model issues and remediation actions. Interact with business units within the client bank to better understand their portfolio, risk exposures and modeling needs.
Work on various ad hoc quantitative, modeling, and programming assignments.
Senior Quantitative ModelerFor its Risk Modeling & Analytics Group, the client bank is looking for a Senior Quantitative Modeling Associate to develop analytical methods and models that assess the credit risk of financial products. This individual will build and perform qualitative and quantitative analysis on all credit portfolios and credit risk analytics.Requirements:Required - Senior Quantitative Modeler
PhD or Master’s degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Operations Research, Mathematics or related quantitative field
At least 4 years hands on work and research experience of advanced analytical skills in the areas of statistics, economic/econometrics modeling and data mining applicable to risk management in banking industry
5+ years of experience of analytical and modeling methods including binary and multinomial logistic regression, multivariate analysis, cluster analysis, time series analysis, and panel data analysis
5+ years of experience in programming languages and statistical software including SAS, SQL Working knowledge of SAS or other advanced statistical/econometric analysis software
The ability to understand generally accepted accounting principles
Ability to clearly present analytical findings and methodology to both technical and non-technical audiences and make business recommendations via the use of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office with advanced experience in Excel
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills with business intuition and intellectual curiosity
Ability to multi-tasking and stay organized and focused on delivering results

title: Data Scientist

details:
BEPC is searching for a talented Research Scientist II candidate to join a reputable pharmaceutical company in Hayward, CA for a 7-month contract.
 
JOB SUMMARY:
Work in a Flow Cytometry Applications Group in an Research and Development environment to develop novel cutting-edge solutions for research and diagnostic products on our flow cytometry-based platforms. We are seeking a highly motivated, creative and versatile scientist who has excellent analytical and communication skills.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Develop novel cell-based or blood-based assays on flow cytometry platforms using cutting edge, strategies, reagents and instruments for research and diagnostic products. 
Design complete solutions spanning assays, instruments and software; optimize assay conditions, improve product design and related processes and procedures, and troubleshoot technical issues. Work on new Product Introduction in support of design transfer from R&D
Utilize, maintain and troubleshoot flow cytometry based and /microscopy-based instrument platforms. 
Work closely with applications, engineering and software R&D groups in defining and developing product features. 
Strong documentation skills, maintain lab notebooks, follow SOP’s, and maintain records as needed. Author SOP’s and product related documentation 
Occasional travel to customer or collaborator sites 
Actively participate in routine lab maintenance and lab safety procedures. 
Present technical status-updates to colleagues and collaborators. 


REQUIREMENTS:

B.S. degree with 2+ years of industrial experience or M.S with 0+ years industrial experience in biochemistry, immunology, microbiology or cell biology
Demonstrate hands on experience in cell-culture methods with mammalian or micro-organism culture, blood-based assays, cellular assays, immunoassays, bead-based assays and flow cytometry or microscopy methods. 
Excellent knowledge of cell culture techniques, flow cytometry and cell biology of multiple organisms. 
Good understanding/application of antibodies, fluorescence-based probes, dyes etc. Good background in cell biology with understanding of apoptosis/cell health pathways. 
Prior flow cytometry-based product development experiences an added plus. 
Must demonstrate ability to design and conduct experiments, critically analyze and interpret data, put together summaries and present findings with minimal supervision. 
Strong collaborative, inter-personal and oral communication skills. 
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) required - experience with statistical analysis) preferred. Strong data analysis skills.

Candidate Requirements:
This position is NOT open to corp2corp, or corp2hire

Compensation:
Negotiable (Generally $40/hr to $45/hr)

Benefits:
Available

Job Description:
HRU Technical Resources has partnered with a Michigan based automotive and engineering company to place a Principal Engineer (PE).  The successful candidate will demonstrate experience in the design, analysis, manufacturing and assembly of complex mechanical systems which may include composite structures and weldments.  Primary responsibilities include performing job captain duties on small to large projects such as design, component specification, engineering calculations, hazard and failure mode effects analysis, FEA analysis, presenting design reviews, manufacturing support, installation, test and adjust, acceptance testing, and general project management.  Other responsibilities include mentoring of associate level engineers and providing a second set of eyes support to ensure compliance with the design work flow process, industry standards, and codes.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher engineering degree required. Master’s degree preferred.
MUST be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) - NO EXCEPTIONS
MINIMUM 7 years proven experience in design of heavy mechanical equipment such as large conveyance systems, automotive, agricultural, or large robotic systems. (automation, material handling)
Able to communicate technical concepts in writing as well as through verbal communication.
Demonstrated excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills to audiences at executive, peer and supporting levels.
Demonstrated proficiency with CAD software, preferably SolidWorks.
Demonstrated experience successfully completing multiple, concurrent, engineering tasks and projects.
Experience with static and dynamic analysis to optimize fabricated structures.
Knowledge of complex mechanical systems such as hydraulics, pneumatics and electric motors/actuators.
Knowledge of welded joints and associated residual stress, distortion and related metallurgical processes.
Knowledge of bolted joints and the associated threaded fasteners.
Knowledge and understanding of design for welding and composite structures.
Demonstrated, timely, field troubleshooting experience including solution development and implementation in the industrial controls, automation, automotive, mechanical systems or transportation industries.
Demonstrated experience leading technical groups and multidiscipline teams.
Demonstrated experience partnering across multiple disciplines and organizations while managing expectations of diverse stakeholders.
Proven record of strong leadership and partnering skills with good coaching abilities.
Awareness of basic control systems to enable some understanding of the interface with the customer’s ride control system.
Must be a self-starter, detailed oriented, and have the ability to work independently to meet tight deadlines.
Demonstrated proficiency in utilizing Microsoft Office software including Excel, Word, Outlook, Project and PowerPoint.


Responsibilities:

Lead the design and release of complete assemblies working within an integrated project team.
Lead and oversee structural, dynamic, and kinematic analysis, as appropriate, in support of project specific requirements.
Responsible for planning, estimating, scheduling, conducting the technical aspects of engineering projects.
Provide timely, clear, and concise communication to management, customers, partners, and team members about work status and impacts to project.
Provide engineering recommendations, with proposed actions and suggested priorities, for the resolution of operational and mechanical problems.
Prepare engineering test scopes, plans, and reports (e.g. Acceptance Testing and Performance Testing) as well as perform testing and writing of test reports.
Provide timely creation/review of engineering design, change, and release documents.
Accountable to maintain the technical aspects of engineering projects within allocated budget and schedule limits.
Additional responsibilities may include the peer review of work performed by others; mentoring less experienced engineers and designers; and developing and managing scopes, budgets and schedules for departmental and multi-discipline projects.


Workplace Environment:

1st (day) shift
Approximately 15% domestic and international travel to client sites will be required.

details:
Senior Research Scientist I, Immuno-Oncology in Buffalo, NY

Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. 

 The Senior Research Scientist I, Immuno-oncology is a specialist researcher in oncology and/or immunology with a thorough understanding of the field and experience producing screening assays and reagents for the effective evaluation of compounds or biologics in vitro and ex vivo as anti-tumor therapeutic agents. They are expected to demonstrate a track record of publications in the field, provide a source of quality ideas and demonstrate a consistent ability to solve problems relating to the discovery and development of drugs for the treatment of immune response related disorders. 

A detailed understanding of immune checkpoint pathways and their roles in tumor development and neurodegenerative disorders is of particular interest. Specific duties include: supervision and development of a team of research biologists; design and development of value-added tools (assays) for the identification and prioritization of active compounds; development of technologies and platforms for the unambiguous identification of the mechanism(s) of action of actives; problem solving (experiments, equipment, data analysis templates); analysis and interpretation of experimental results and literature publications; management of client projects; collation of data and recommendations; and preparation of high quality reports for circulation to customers or AMRI management. Major components of the scientist's performance rating will be based on innovation; supervisory and technical leadership; productivity of self and team; analytical competence; intellectual contributions to products and projects; and strategic decision making.


The scientist is expected to be self motivated, demonstrate initiative in handling responsibilities, work effectively as a team member and as a project team leader and strive to do their job better. The Senior Research Scientist I is expected to supervise and develop junior scientists while performing technical duties and project management. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Display a thorough understanding of current thinking regarding the role of the immune response and response-control mechanisms in oncology and various forms of immune response related disease.
Development of next generation in vitro models for evaluating the effectiveness of compounds for treatment of specific tumors and immune response-related diseases. Generation of case studies, publications and content to support marketing of these capabilities as services. 
Supervision and development of junior scientists and collaboration with peers to ensure project goals are met effectively and on schedule. This includes the responsibility to ensure direct reports and project team members receive the appropriate motivation and education required to meet project goals.
Act as a technical expert and resource for site management and the business development team in their efforts to market biology and in vitro pharmacology services.
Work closely with business development and scientific colleagues to convert communications with potential clients into attractive research plans, internal cost estimates and formal project proposals.
Collaborate with other biology and chemistry staff to coordinate project progress and the use of resources
Act as a technical consultant; volunteer suggestions on oncology-related assay technologies, screening strategies, mechanism of action determination strategies (and technologies) and reagent procurement. Perform literature searches to collect information from a spectrum of sources. 
Devise new or improved procedures for existing projects, as required. Originate novel ideas or approaches to other’s projects. Contribute suggestions to coworkers. Recommend and implement methods to increase the quality of products and services.
Publish scientific work, maintain useful external contacts and participate in professional societies in a manner which will bring forth useful information and enhance the scientific reputation of both the Senior Research Scientist I and the Company.
Use of sound judgment, acquired knowledge and experience to develop new reagents, assays, protocols and strategies for the identification and prioritization of active samples. These tasks will often require extensive literature searching, as well as contact with suppliers, colleagues and customers, etc.
Adapt to changing priorities such that productivity and efficiency are unaffected.
Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner.  Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan and the Biosafety, Blood Borne Pathogen and Radiation Safety Procedures provided by the company. Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels.
Keep accurate, legible and complete records of all experiments and observations. Record all appropriate data electronically in AMRI databases. Comply with the AMRI laboratory notebook keeping practices assigned to the Buffalo, NY site and ensure all scientists within your team(s) comply with those policies.
Submit acceptable written periodic reports.  Prepare summaries of experimental findings reliably and independently. Document client meeting agendas and outcomes accurately and in a timely manner.
Discuss routinely with supervisor the status of assigned programs and potential problems.
Communicate orally and in writing unexpected occurrences which could adversely affect established timetables.
Manage workload and time to enable the incumbent to perform multiple projects effectively, and ensure all necessary paperwork is completed on a timely basis.



 Education and/or Experience


Doctorate Degree with a major in Pharmacology, Biology or Biochemistry, or equivalent industrial experience


An established record of achievements in immunology, immune-oncology, oncology or immuno-neurodegenerative disease research


Computer training including use of software associated with data analysis and screening


Other pertinent training/courses

title: Data Scientist

details:
This position does not require relocation.
 
Energy Engineering & Consulting Services, LLC (EECS) is a well-established energy consulting firm with over 18 years of experience supplying services to the federal government and industrial customers with placements throughout the world.  We are a progressive company where employees have direct contact with senior management. 
 
Measurement and Verification (M&V) Analyst
EECS has open positions for an energy engineer that is capable of performing measurement and verification of energy conservation projects to assure that implemented projects are generating the projected energy savings and meeting M&V requirements.  These projects are located on military installations throughout the United States and in some foreign countries.  A team of EECS engineers will verify the performance of equipment on-site for approximately one week.  After data has been gathered, the employees will work from their home office via the internet and telephone conversations with their other team members to develop a report of their findings which will be sent back to the company home office for review, compilation, and distribution. The type of equipment that might be analyzed would include chilled water systems, HVAC systems, boilers, air compressors, air handlers, solar, wind turbines, geothermal, cogeneration, and various distribution systems. 
 
This position allows for travel in the United States with flexible time for employees to enjoy the location. The employees will also spend up to three weeks each month at their personal home office working on the M&V report which provides the opportunity for flexible work hours.  These positions are great opportunities for people who wish to travel and explore other cities in the United States.  All travel expenses while on the job are paid for the employer.

Measurement and Verification (M&V) Analyst
 
The successful candidate for these positions should possess the ability to analyze existing systems’ performance for energy efficiency as well as maintenance and operations.  They must analyze data and develop reports demonstrating problems of systems and their potential solutions.
 
Basic Requirements
1.      Must be a United States citizen.
2.      A four-year engineering degree in mechanical or electrical engineering with a minimum of 5 to 15 years of experience in energy management.
3.      Be able to communicate both in verbal and written forms and the ability to utilize Word, Excel spreadsheets, and other basic computer programs.
 
Preferred certifications in one or more of the following:
1.     Registered Professional Engineer (PE)
2.     Certified Energy Manager (CEM)
3.     Certified Measurement & Verification Professional (CMVP)
4.     Certified Energy Auditor (CEA)
5.      Certification as a Commissioning Authority (CxA)
 
6.      Certified Building Commissioning Professional (CBCP)

details:
Responsible for assuring the reliability and uptime of all critical utility and mechanical systems. This is accomplished by auditing and optimizing our PMs on all critical pieces of equipment, training our craftsmen on how to optimize uptime and performance of this equipment, life cycle asset management of all utility systems, leading the site predictive maintenance program, and partnering with process area owners to ensure equipment reliability. 

Responsibilities


Identifies and solves repetitive problems through reliability studies and bad actor reviews
Support TPM activities throughout the plant by optimization of PMs, looking for inspection opportunities on critical equipment, and regular analysis of SAP activity report data for entire facility.
Produces monthly site reliability reports and participates in group reliability meetings to facilitate information sharing and learning between manufacturing facilities
Provides the definition of current maintenance and reliability KPI measures. Establishes systems for capturing data required for KPIs and then steps to post them. Trains users on capturing and calculating the data required for KPIs.
Provides comprehensive review and analysis of failure and preventative maintenance activities; Identifies and solves repetitive problems through the relentless pursuit of root causes to stop failures.
Administers the component change out plan and schedule for continuous minors tracking component failure with manufacturing tons.
Tracks the impact and changes in component change out frequency with execution of reliability actions to identify and communicate successes for long term commitment and sustainability of the reliability program
Works closely with the project engineers to build reliability into new projects
Serves as a technical resource for engineers and craftspeople on reliability issues and trains foremen and craftspeople in all matters pertaining to reliability.
Performs other duties as assigned.



Qualifications


BS/BA in Mechanical Engineering (preferred) or other appropriate engineering discipline
Five (5) years previous experience in maintenance reliability
Must be a self-starter with the ability to plan, organize and carry out project assignments within a high pressure environment
Excellent data analysis skills including use of SAP and MS Excel

details:
Our client has an immediate need for an experienced Taxonomist Specialist to help with strategies to promote products through the Website Marketing efforts. Our client's E-Business Teams are responsible for development and implementation of strategies intended to promote the organization's products and/or services through website marketing. They analyze and design eCommerce applications to meet business process initiatives. As a member of the E-Business team, you will support the work required to maintain their taxonomy, information architecture, and content and knowledge management projects to sustain a customer-centric online catalog. You will lead taxonomy development initiatives, work directly with and negotiate across internal business units as well as drive project objectives. You will help establish and govern company-wide best practices and assist with developing methodologies for all taxonomy projects. You will be involved in the large-scale normalization of an existing product data taxonomy in the Electronics industry. Extremely high attention to detail and ability to work at a granular level to sift through, meticulously organize and identify mutually exclusive concepts to build a preferred vocabulary that will be applied to their digital online catalog.Requirements: 
Ability to logically and methodically work through large data sets using Excel and/or Access
Find patterns of commonality in the use of terms in an existing product data taxonomy to build a vocabulary of Preferred Attribute Names and Values
Aptitude for understanding system integrations and the effect on downstream systems when implementing mass updates to the taxonomy structure and associated product data 
Responsibilities:
Supports the Taxonomy Team in the development and maintenance of taxonomies, including the reviewing of content for possible gaps in coverage, identifying new terms, synonyms and term relationships
Creates categorization rules for new taxonomy terms as well as maintains and improves rules for existing terms
Evaluates search performance and the relevancy of search results using a quality assurance scorecard to identify areas for improvement
Generates analytical reports on categorization, search and related user behavior
Provides stakeholders guidance on taxonomy and findability as well as explains decisions made by taxonomy team
Explores innovations and best practices within the discipline
Recommends and leads implementation of improvements 
Education Required / Qualifications:
Master's Degree in library or information science
1 to 2 years of experience in taxonomy, controlled vocabulary and metadata development
Understanding of taxonomy best practices and standards
Familiarity with the engineering and manufacturing industry preferred
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
English language skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) 
Other Desired Qualifications Include:
Experience with online Hybris catalog and Synaptica taxonomy management systems
Experience with AEM content management digital asset management systems
Experience managing taxonomies for large websites
Experience doing user research and usability testing
Experience preparing business or technical documentation
We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Data Scientist

details: This position may also work from home, if necessary.  The PARS Statistician is responsible for development and maintenance of the Probe Analytics Risk Score (PARSTM) used to gauge the potential for waste and abuse on a health care claim. The Statistician will define and develop metrics to measure PARS performance and prepare monthly performance reports for management. The Statistician will test and monitor performance of the scoring system as the monthly system enhancements are implemented and recommend changes to the scoring methodology as necessary to maintain performance. The PARS Statistician reports to the SVP of Analytics.  Essential Job Functions Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: * Design and architect of PARS algorithm and enhancements. * Development of PARS performance metrics. * Monthly monitoring and reporting of PARS performance. * Participant in analytics planning and release review teams to ensure that scoring impacts are considered. * Learn and become comfortable with the data model utilized in the analytics system. Perform complex ad hoc queries against the data tables to support PARS development and test work. * Gain a comprehensive understanding of the overall analytics methodology and become familiar with all analytic factors that contribute to the PARS algorithm. * Assist in debugging, enhancing and improving PARS performance as issues arise on individual claims. * Opportunity to be present as the PARS expert in client and sales meetings.
title: Data Scientist

details:
Job Description - Machine Learning Specialist
MACHINE LEARNING SCIENTIST
Seeking an experienced Machine Learning Scientist to join an established and growing data-centric organization downtown.  The Machine Learning Scientist will be responsible for machine learning and statistical techniques to address business goals and assess future enhancements for the company's platform. Ideal candidates will have strong fundamentals in statistical methods, machine learning as well as experience in product-focused software development.  The Machine Learning Specialist will be integral in evaluating the possibilities for future product enhancements, developing proof-of-concepts, and creating documentation to guide the development of market-ready tools by other developers on the team.  
 
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the development of new products through analysis, sound engineering, and the application of machine learning.
Create such things as visualizations, metrics, algorithms, statistical tests, classifiers/regressors, and data structures.
Locate and vet new libraries, data stores, algorithms, and other new technologies to support the various data products.
Build tools to make your work, the work of the analytics team, and analysis efforts in the entire company easier, more repeatable, and higher quality.
Participate in research to keep our products competitive and intelligent through machine learning and artificial intelligence. 
Provide consultation to all areas of the business about what is impossible, maybe possible, or possible as it relates to machine learning.
Promulgate analysis techniques and technologies through the organization.
Manage workflow using JIRA, participate in discovery and sprint planning.
Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to commercialize data products.
 
Requirements:
Graduate degree in an analytical field (computer science, applied statistics, etc.)
Solid experience with or demonstrated knowledge of Machine Learning techniques.  
Natural Language Processing, is a plus.
Some intriguing stories about how you've employed clustering, regression, classification, anomaly detection to solve business problems.
Experience with tools for preprocessing, automated model selection and hyper-parameter optimization.  Experience with TensorFlow and Keras is a plus.
Strong programming skills, preferably using some combination of Python, R, Java, and Groovy.  Experience developing scalable algorithms using Spark, Beam or other big data tools.
SQL
Ability to match the appropriate analytical technique to sometimes ambiguous problems and large, messy & unstructured data sets.
High energy and drive, coupled with resourcefulness, required to succeed in a start-up environment
Passion for problem solving and knowledge sharing
Ability to shift priorities quickly and efficiently, and easily adapt to change
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

You will collaborate with a small team of engineers and programmers to develop advanced technologies for both internally funded research and client-funded applications. You will have access to the hardware and software tools that you need to effectively design, develop and test CV/ML technologies.
